chapter_1_act_3_scene_430_text: We’re not just guardians in training anymore! Let’s show this city we’re real heroes!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_440_text: Welcome to VC! Now, get out!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_450_text: Cut through everything! Don’t let these chumps touch you!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_460_text: Ha… ha… Okay, maybe that wasn’t as bad as I...
chapter_1_act_3_scene_480_text: I think so? I don’t see any more monsters.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_text: And all that stuff that was warping the street is gone. I hesitate to say it, but…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_responseA: I think we might have won?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_responseB: We saved the city! WE SAVED THE CITY!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_510_text: OUR FIRST REAL VICTORY! …Is what Miss Sona said. Right, Miss Sona?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_520_text: That was crazy! I was over there, like, fwoom! And then Sona was, like, bwong! And you guys were, like, boooom! It was awesome!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_530_text: Semi-related, but there is a huge magical wall blocking the end of the street that I may have put there and cannot remove. We should go.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_540_text: You’re never this amped at school, Tali.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_550_text: Because I don’t have star powers or a cool outfit there, duh. Also, I smashed this monster with a huge rock, and it was like, “Bleeeurgh”.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_560_text: …Thanks, everyone. Let’s get out of here before people start to notice what we look like.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_570_text: Aw, come on. I wanna be a bootleg action figure like Rakan or that blonde dude… Ezmorp? You know, the blue one.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_600_text: We can save it for a victory meal tomorrow, alright?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_610_text: Boooooo! We want a speech, or to be bootleg Star Guardian action figures with weird names!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_620_text: If we leave now, I’ll do the speech tomorrow at Noodle Bill’s.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_630_text: Noodle Bill’s?! Everyone go home! We’re done here!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_660_text: One thing I need to ask, though… Did it feel like this was a test? Those things went down… almost too easily.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_690_text: Let’s just bask in our very first victory!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_710_text: WHAT DID I SAY WRONG?! WAS IT BASK?! I HAVE A VERY LARGE VOCABULARY!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_720_text: Heh. But, yeah… makes you wonder…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_730_text: Who else might be watching us?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_10_text: Monsters, tons of them. They’re kinda puny by themselves, but there are at least a few dozen out there.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_20_text: We don’t know where they came from. And everything’s all… messed up… like when that creepy monster attacked us.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_30_text: I was wondering about that. The pattern looks familiar… What was that creature’s name? Fiddlesticks?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_40_text: Ugh, I don’t wanna think about that thing. It showed up in my dreams… I’ll never forget that voice…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_10_text: Copy that, Cap’n Kai. What’s the big plan?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_20_text: Hm. Looks like a few dozen of them, and they’re coming out of that checkerboard goop.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_30_text: Sweep the street. We hit fast and hard, and close that breach.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_40_text: Got it. What do we do if that Fiddlesticks thing shows up?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_50_text: Ugh… Do you think it will?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270c_40_text: Yeah, yeah, very funny. That pattern on the street looks a lot like Fiddlesticks, so if we run into it, maybe it’ll share your sense of humor.
ekko_1_scene_10_text: Alright, there’s no way you’ll be able to compute this equation at such a speed.
ekko_1_scene_40_text: [Hm. Professor Ikari’s been testing Ekko to see if he can answer different math problems… before she can type them into a calculator.]
ekko_1_scene_50_text: [He’s using his Star Guardian powers right out in the open. Idiot!]
ekko_1_scene_90_text: What can I say? This man’s got all the answers.
ekko_1_scene_110_text: If I could rewind time, I definitely wouldn’t use it to impress my math class.
ekko_1_scene_120_text: You’d probably go back to last week, when you fell on your face in front of the entire class.
ekko_1_scene_130_text: Akali, you fool! Why didn’t you double knot your laces?!
ekko_1_scene_140_text: …Do you think we should talk to him?
ekko_1_scene_150_text: Ekko? What, for the answers to the big test on Friday?
ekko_1_scene_160_text: No! Talk to him about misusing his Star Guardian abilities.
ekko_1_scene_170_text: This again? You worry too much. I mean, it’s not like he’s gonna get caught.
ekko_1_scene_180_text: And even if he does, he can just rewind time to before he gets caught. Problem solved.
ekko_1_scene_200_text: Being a Star Guardian is about responsibility. Honor. Loyal—
ekko_1_scene_210_text: I took the oath the same day as you. We’re co-leaders. Not that anyone seems to remember…
ekko_1_scene_220_text: If it’s bugging you so much, go talk to the kid. Use your powers of being a giant buzzkill.
ekko_1_scene_240_text: [There he is… It's like he’s avoiding me…]
ekko_1_scene_270_text: Been asking around for you. Feel like I keep showing up right after you leave.
ekko_1_scene_300_text: How strange. I sort of have that problem, too…
ekko_1_scene_310_text: I can’t hang out this weekend.
ekko_1_scene_320_text: I have a… project I’m working on.
ekko_1_scene_330_text: I didn’t ask you to hang out.
ekko_1_scene_340_text: Oh. Well, you were going to.
ekko_1_scene_350_text: You’ve already had this conversation before, haven’t you?
ekko_1_scene_370_text: There were a couple repeats where I managed to sneak away. Those were my favorites.
ekko_1_scene_370_responseA: So you were avoiding me? I knew it!
ekko_1_scene_370_responseB: Well, this version of me managed to track you down.
ekko_1_scene_370_responseC: That’s it, hand over the time egg before you summon a planet-eating lava parasite.
ekko_1_scene_390_text: You can’t keep doing this, Ekko. Rewinding conversations so you say the right thing. Rewinding math class so you have the right answer…
ekko_1_scene_400_text: I’m not cheating at math! Why do you always say that?
ekko_1_scene_420_text: No. I’m just good at solving advanced equations in my head.
ekko_1_scene_430_text: [Huh. Guess that makes sense. The kid is a brainiac, after all.]
ekko_1_scene_460_text: And what point was that… captain?
ekko_1_scene_470_text: My point was that, as your cap… Ugh, I’m telling you to only use your abilities to…
ekko_1_scene_500_text: Wasn’t a guess. And… you don’t have to worry. I can never change the past anyways. Not when it really matters.
ekko_1_scene_520_responseA: What exactly is the project you’re working on?
ekko_1_scene_520_responseB: Do you have the math homework?
ekko_1_scene_520_responseC: What am I going to say next?
ekko_1_scene_550_text: [I’m not giving up on you that easy, kid.]
ekko_1_scene_570_text: [Okay, so following Ekko home might not have been a high point for me as a Star Guardian…]
ekko_1_scene_580_text: [...but I have to figure out what he’s up to.]
ekko_1_scene_610_text: Huh. You’re earlier than last time… captain.
ekko_1_scene_530a_10_text: It’s a surprise. Or a… secret.
ekko_1_scene_530b_10_text: You seriously want to cheat off me?
ekko_1_scene_530b_20_text: After making me feel bad for cheating?
ekko_1_scene_530b_40_text: I-I wasn’t going to cheat. I just wanted to… compare answers.
ekko_1_scene_530c_10_text: “That wasn’t what I was gonna say. “
ekko_1_scene_530c_20_text: That wasn’t what I was gonna s—
sona_1_scene_10_text: [RING RONG RING RONG. DING DONG DING DONG.]
sona_1_scene_50_text: [...but Sona’s already shown up late to most of her classes.]
sona_1_scene_100_text: She’s so quiet… How does she manage to move without making any noise?
sona_1_scene_110_text: This is ridiculous! I trained for so long, and Sona’s naturally that stealthy? UGH!
sona_1_scene_130_text: I could sneak past any teacher if I wanted.
sona_1_scene_140_text: I just prefer to arrive on time.
sona_1_scene_160_text: Maybe you’d be better at sneaking if you learned to be quiet every once in a while.
sona_1_scene_180_text: Yesterday, we left off talking about the different types of chemical bonds.
sona_1_scene_190_text: Can anyone tell me what a covalent bond is?
sona_1_scene_210_text: [Ulp! You have got to be kidding me!]
sona_1_scene_210_responseB: I think Akali knows this one.
sona_1_scene_230_text: …A covalent bond is when two atoms share electrons.
sona_1_scene_240_text: It’s my personal favorite bond. Aside from my bond with Mrs. Chuba!
sona_1_scene_260_text: A little teacher humor there. Anybody? No? Well, moving on…
sona_1_scene_270_text: Okay, I mean, sure, his speech was cheesy, but the professor did sort of make me realize something.
sona_1_scene_280_text: Inertia is a property of matter?
sona_1_scene_290_text: Inertia is the… Were we at the same lecture?
sona_1_scene_300_text: Nope. I was on my phone. They added new levels in Hyper Crystal Dungeon Mobile.
sona_1_scene_310_text: I need to get to know Sona better.
sona_1_scene_320_text: How did you get that from a science class?
sona_1_scene_330_text: Working together, combining the best parts of a thing to make an even more powerful whole.
sona_1_scene_340_text: It’s just like being Star Guardians.
sona_1_scene_350_text: This again. So now you’re using chemistry as an excuse to hang out with your team?
sona_1_scene_370_text: Okay, but why Sona and not, for instance, me?
sona_1_scene_380_text: I already know you too well.
sona_1_scene_400_text: Oh! Here she comes! I’ll, uh… talk to you later!
sona_1_scene_440_responseB: What did you think of the lecture?
sona_1_scene_450_text: [Sona rotates her wrist rapidly back and forth.]
sona_1_scene_480_text: Nice! We are in agreement… I think!
sona_1_scene_490_text: By the way… Akali and I noticed that you’ve been late to class a couple times.
sona_1_scene_500_text: It’s not a huge deal. As long as you aren’t late to our battles against the forces of darkness.
sona_1_scene_530_text: Well, if you want to, erm… tell me about it—what’s going on—I’m here.
sona_1_scene_550_text: [Oh, shoot. I don’t know sign language!]
sona_1_scene_560_text: It’s the people, Miss Kai’Sa. They’re running around like mice in a maze!
sona_1_scene_570_text: Chiizu?! You shouldn’t be here! You’ll give us away!
sona_1_scene_580_text: I’ve been here every day! To most non-guardians, I’m invisible unless they know what they’re looking for. Nobody can see me!
sona_1_scene_590_text: Not even you, Miss Kai’Sa! …Except for right now. When you can. Because we’re talking.
sona_1_scene_600_text: Interesting. Must be why nobody ever mentions the other familiars…
sona_1_scene_610_text: But you’re right. It’s too dangerous for me to be talking here… If anyone notices, they might focus on me. And that would blow our cover!
sona_1_scene_620_text: Meet Miss Sona and I at the mall. We’ll explain everything.
sona_1_scene_640_text: And by we, I of course mean… she! She will explain everything! I’m just a humble translator!
sona_1_scene_650_text: I gotta get outta here! Squeak!
sona_1_scene_660_text: Oh. Well, I guess I’ll meet you two… later, then? Please don’t kill each other?
sona_1_scene_670_text: [Sona waves goodbye, then turns angrily toward Chiizu.]
sona_1_scene_680_text: RUN AWAY! SHE’S BRIMMING WITH RAGE!
sona_1_scene_700_text: Professor, one of the lab rats escaped!
sona_1_scene_710_text: Sona was chasing it through the hall! And I think it was wearing… glasses?!
sona_1_scene_220a_10_text: I mean… yes. That’s technically correct.
sona_1_scene_220a_30_text: But not the answer I was looking for.
sona_1_scene_220c_10_text: Are you saying you don’t know the answer?
sona_1_scene_220c_30_text: No, you don’t know the answer? Or no, you know the answer?
sona_1_scene_220c_40_text: I invoke my right to an attorney.
sona_3_scene_10_text: [Okay, so my last attempt to help Sona didn’t go so hot.]
sona_3_scene_20_text: [But now… I’ve got a new plan of attack.]
sona_3_scene_40_text: Oh, come on! Now, of all times?!
sona_3_scene_60_text: I think we’re going to have to postpone our coffee date. Unless that gross monster likes maid cafes.
sona_3_scene_80_text: Of course, Miss Kai’Sa. Should we call the other guardians?
sona_3_scene_90_text: Hmm… This thing doesn’t seem like too big a threat. I think we can take it down.
sona_3_scene_110_text: “I don’t know. He seems pretty big to me.”
sona_3_scene_120_text: Sona, just say the word, and I’ll call them.
sona_3_scene_130_text: But we can do it alone. I’ve watched you train… You’re a lot stronger than you think.
sona_3_scene_150_text: Miss Sona says, “I’m not so sure.”
sona_3_scene_160_text: …Erm, this may not be the time… what with the monster and all… and I don’t want to editorialize again…
sona_3_scene_170_text: But Miss Kai’sa, there is more to Miss Sona’s story…
sona_3_scene_180_text: During the attack, Miss Sona couldn’t move.
sona_3_scene_190_text: She would have been hurt,or even killed, if not for the bravery of a boy…
sona_3_scene_200_text: Someone no older than us. And not one of the Star Guardians… just a boy, with no extraordinary powers.
sona_3_scene_230_text: He… well. If she’d had the light of the First Star then… maybe he wouldn’t have had to save her. And he wouldn’t have been hurt keeping her safe.
sona_3_scene_250_text: I’m sorry, Miss Sona. I promise I won’t say more if you don’t want me to.
sona_3_scene_260_text: Sona… I’m so sorry. I had no idea. But… just because you didn’t have the power to help him then, doesn’t mean you can’t help others now.
sona_3_scene_270_text: Being a Star Guardian doesn’t make you brave. Being brave is what makes you a Star Guardian.
sona_3_scene_300_text: Oh, I know this one! Hang on, let me try this…
sona_3_scene_330_text: Nailed it. Now… you ready to kick monster butt?
sona_3_scene_360_text: Ugh, the air raid siren is going off, too? Come on!
sona_3_scene_370_text: Wait… Sona, I was wrong before!
sona_3_scene_380_text: You shouldn’t try to focus on one sound.
sona_3_scene_390_text: And you shouldn’t try to shut them out, either!
sona_3_scene_410_text: You’re a composer, right? Listen to the music of the city!
sona_3_scene_410_responseA: That roar… it’s kinda like a cymbal, isn’t it?
sona_3_scene_410_responseB: The siren. It’s laying down a steady beat.
sona_3_scene_410_responseC: That guy playing the skinny trumpet on the street corner!
sona_3_scene_470_text: Good. Use it. Now, let’s mop up that giant freak before the cafe closes.
sona_3_scene_510_text: Ugh, I shouldn’t have said that. Burned a lot of calories out there. Now, I want cake.
sona_3_scene_530_text: Sona! You killed it! Literally! Your music powers are so strong!
sona_3_scene_540_text: Miss Sona was incredible! She was all, “Bang! Pow! Pow!” And the monster was all, “SCREEEECH!”
sona_3_scene_550_text: Heh. I see you’ve been hanging out with Taliyah.
sona_3_scene_580_text: [Sign language! And you understand it now! Okay, Kai’Sa… you got this.]
sona_3_scene_590_text: [You’ve been practicing your signs. You’ve done your homework. The moment is perfect. Please don’t screw it up…]
sona_3_scene_590_responseB: “We should start a band. I can play the triangle!”
sona_3_scene_590_responseC: “Let’s get out of here before they make us clean this up.”
sona_3_scene_610_text: I’ll just have to take your word for it, Chiizu.
sona_3_scene_620_text: I’m impressed, Miss Kai’Sa. Your sign language has greatly improved!
sona_3_scene_630_text: A captain’s got to be able to communicate with her team.
sona_3_scene_660_text: I’m here for you. We all are. I know it won’t always be easy…
sona_3_scene_670_text: Some days, you might not be able to handle the crowds.
sona_3_scene_690_text: [“Just take it one… note at a time.”]
sona_3_scene_700_text: [“You don’t know anything about music, do you?”]
sona_3_scene_710_text: I know about autotune. Does that count?
sona_3_scene_750_text: Ooh! I’ll get my wood block!
sona_3_scene_760_text: Don’t start the lesson without me! The great wood block musician and interpreter extraordinaire, Chiizu! Squeak!
sona_3_scene_420a_10_text: I see, Miss Kai’Sa! It’s all part of a symphony!
sona_3_scene_420b_10_text: I see, Miss Kai’Sa! It’s all part of a symphony!
sona_3_scene_420c_20_text: Is it not called the skinny trumpet?! Who told me…? Ekko. I swear, when this is over...
sona_3_scene_420c_30_text: But I see…! It’s all part of a symphony.
sona_3_scene_600a_30_text: Yeah, I know you understood her without me! But I’m not giving up my job! This economy is brutal!
sona_3_scene_600b_10_text: [“My music is more of a solo act.”]
sona_3_scene_600b_20_text: Sona… will think about it, Miss Kai’Sa.
sona_3_scene_600b_30_text: See? That was interpreting for extra politeness. I’m also learning things!
sona_3_scene_600c_20_text: Sona would like to stay. For a little while.
sona_3_scene_600c_30_text: At least until people start to gather. Our cover can’t be blown yet, squeak!
akali_1_scene_20_text: Slow down, Akali. Those noodles aren’t going anywhere.
akali_1_scene_30_text: Mrnch… ulp… Yeah they are. Into my… mrmph…. mouth.
akali_1_scene_40_text: You’re gonna get a stomachache. And we have training later—
akali_1_scene_50_text: And the award for best impression of my dad goes to…
akali_1_scene_70_text: Mrmph… slurp…. You know how you can help me?
akali_1_scene_80_text: Ugh, watching this is so gross. How?
akali_1_scene_90_text: Order me a refill. I’m running low.
akali_1_scene_100_text: Nobody runs low on my watch.
akali_1_scene_120_text: See, someone knows when they’re wanted.
akali_1_scene_140_text: Mmrmph… slurp… mrnchh… Uh… Bill? Are you still there?
akali_1_scene_190_text: It’s okay. I’m not here to talk about you. I’ve got problems of my own.
akali_1_scene_200_text: I’m sure it doesn’t compare to your little high-school adventures…
akali_1_scene_210_text: But for me? This day was pretty memorable.
akali_1_scene_220_text: Are you going to tell the story, or can I finish eating this like a monster?
akali_1_scene_240_text: Every morning, I wake up early to make my broth.
akali_1_scene_250_text: I like to read the paper while I let the flavors mix… But today, I felt like taking a walk.
akali_1_scene_280_text: Valoran City is peaceful in the early hours of the day. A special sort of quiet.
akali_1_scene_290_text: I was enraptured by the smells of fresh bread warming in the oven…
akali_1_scene_300_text: Of the light reflecting off tiny droplets of dew on freshly cut grass…
akali_1_scene_310_text: Before I knew it, I had spent hours walking through our city, and I found myself in a place that I didn’t recognize…
akali_1_scene_320_text: “Oh, no!” I thought. “I must get back to my broth! If it reaches a boil, my hard work—and the day’s profits—will be lost.”
akali_1_scene_330_text: But I had been so swept up by beauty on my stroll, that I had not traced my steps. I rushed through the streets, and by sheer luck, I found my way back to my stand.
akali_1_scene_340_text: My broth still simmered lightly. All was well.
akali_1_scene_360_text: Don’t lie to the man, Kai! Bill, what are you even saying? That was your most boring story yet!
akali_1_scene_370_text: Gah hah! I appreciate your feedback, Akali.
akali_1_scene_380_text: But I think perhaps you both missed the moral of my tale.
akali_1_scene_430_text: Isn’t it obvious, Kai’sa? Bill is saying the pork broth is his friend.
akali_1_scene_460_text: Not quite. But friendship is like a good broth.
akali_1_scene_470_text: You put in time. And effort. That’s the chicken feet. And love. The pig bones.
akali_1_scene_480_text: And you must know that even when you aren’t there… the friendship will simmer on.
akali_1_scene_490_text: Love is like… boiling pig bones?
akali_1_scene_500_text: Well said, noodle man. Very wise. Love the part about the feet and bones.
akali_1_scene_510_text: You weren’t even listening. You were about to doze off with noodles still in your mouth! Again!
akali_1_scene_520_text: Sorry, I’m just exhausted from all our late nights training.
akali_1_scene_530_text: Training! My, my. What sport do you play?
akali_1_scene_560_text: Well, I’m sure you’re both very hard workers! At tennis. The game you both play.
akali_1_scene_580_text: …Alright, that’s it for me. Thanks for the noodles, Noodle Bill. Tasty as always.
akali_1_scene_620_text: ...Great. Gonna have to beg dad for more spending money.
akali_1_scene_660_text: I used to be a better friend, but lately…
akali_1_scene_680_text: You want some more advice from a wise, old cook?
akali_1_scene_700_responseC: …Maybe you should stick to making noodles.
akali_1_scene_720_text: Trust in your friend. She trusts in you.
akali_1_scene_730_text: If that’s true, she doesn’t show it.
akali_1_scene_740_text: That just means she needs you to trust in her even more. So sayeth Noodle Bill!
akali_1_scene_770_text: Oh… uh… Put it on our tab.
akali_1_scene_710a_20_text: But couldn’t it? Get easier, I mean. If I figure out a plan of attack. Face my problems… head on…?
akali_1_scene_710a_30_text: You solve one problem, another takes its place.
akali_1_scene_710a_40_text: Heh. Now you sound like Akali.
akali_1_scene_710b_10_text: Gah hah! I didn’t say it was helpful advice.
akali_1_scene_710b_20_text: But if life is so hard… then why do you seem so happy?
akali_1_scene_710b_30_text: I have good customers and great friends! Friends like my pork broth.
akali_1_scene_710c_20_text: But if we all did only what was comfortable, the future would be written in stone.
akali_1_scene_710c_30_text: So... I’m just supposed to act impulsively?

tutorial.step_0:
Welcome to Starlight OS.

I’ll guide you through what’s new so you can complete your Star Guardian training. Let’s get started!
tutorial.step_1:
Chapters are your recorded adventures as a Star Guardian.

See that pink meter? That represents your strength, or Starlight. Fill the meter by playing games to earn rewards and unlock new stories.
tutorial.step_2: Each chapter has three Acts that unlock as you gain Starlight. Remember that you can navigate to a chapter to watch acts you’ve unlocked at any time.
tutorial.step_3:
So far I’ve only walked you through features in the Main Story, but there’s Guardian Stories for you to browse too.

If you see an icon, don’t be alarmed! That just means you have new content to watch.
tutorial.step_4:
Look, it’s you and your friends! Your relationships with them are represented by your Bond.

Play games and complete specific Guardian missions to improve your Bond Level.
tutorial.step_5:
Hover over a Star Guardian’s portrait to see your progress towards the next Bond Level.

For more information, click their portrait to see their specific Guardian missions, rewards, and stories!
tutorial.step_6: And that’s about it! You can click the TUTORIAL button to refresh your memory, or click the INFO button to learn more about gaining Starlight and Bonds. Good luck!
info.section_1.heading: GAIN STARLIGHT
info.section_1.subheading: Starlight represents your strength as a Star Guardian. Play matchmade games of SR, ARAM, TFT, or USB to earn Starlight and progress through each chapter in the Main Story.
info.section_1.goal_2.description: Play/win an ARAM, TFT, or USB game
info.section_1.goal_3.description: Play as any champion in the Star Guardian universe
info.section_1.goal_4.description: Play with 1/2/3+ Star Guardian skins on your team
info.section_2.heading: GAIN BONDS
info.section_2.subheading: Bonds represent your relationships with each of the Star Guardians. Play matchmade games of SR, ARAM, TFT, or USB to increase your Bond with each Star Guardian and advance their Guardian Story.
info.section_2.goal_1.description: Play a game of Summoner’s Rift
info.section_2.goal_2.description: Play an ARAM, TFT, or USB game
info.section_2.goal_4.description: Play as the champion’s Star Guardian skin
info.section_2.goal_5.description: Complete a champion’s specific Star Guardian mission
